title._content: Conscientious Objectors at Camp Pike, Arkansas, 1918

description._content:
Chris (C. L.) Graber, a Mennonite from Washington, Iowa, is hunched down, second from right.  This group of twenty-two persons included fifteen Mennonites, two International Bible Students and five Quakers: Homer Moore, Henry Brenneman, Herman Swartzendruber, Peter Swartzendruber, Samuel Swartzendruber, Fred Swartzendruber, Emerson Rogers, Joe Byler, Dole Mary, W. Perry Kissick, Oliver Yoder, William Treder, William Steensma, Solomon Ropp, Ezra Miller, Merlin Chamness, Milton Brenneman, Lewis Slaubaugh, Loyd Brenneman, Elby Yoder and C. L. Graber [Graber only names twenty-one persons].  Photograph is attached to page 12 in this 1918-19 Diary by C. L. Graber.  Sixteen of the twenty-two are photographed here.

Can you help us identify who is who?  If so, please leave a comment.

C. L. Graber Papers. HM1-209. Mennonite Church USA Archives-Goshen. Goshen, Indiana.
